| Section8 = {{Chembox Related OtherAnions = Mercury(I) fluoride Mercury(I)
| bromide Mercury(I) iodide OtherCations = Mercury(II) chloride
  }} }} 'Mercury(I) chloride' is the chemical compound with the formula
  Hg 2Cl 2. Also known as 'calomel' (a mineral form, rarely
  found in nature) or 'mercurous chloride', this dense white or yellowish-white,
  odorless solid is the principal example of a mercury(I) compound. It is a
  component of reference electrodes in electrochemistry.
